Summary

Bio

Interests

I'm a physicist by training (UC Berkeley 2019 - Go Bears!), a passionate lifelong learner, an educator, and

I am a recent graduate from UC Berkeley Physics (2019). Go Bears! Currently, I'm a STEM teacher at ARISE High School in Oakland, CA—I teach physics, engineering, and computer science. In the Berkeley Physics community I was called the biggest physics nerd around, and I still wear that label with pride.

On a purely intellectual level, I could be satisfied for the rest of my life as a tenured theoretical particle physicist. However, I feel the existential pressure to do something about climate change, so I've decided against the academic route. What drives me now is the mission to avert the climate crisis, and I hope to spend my career advancing technological solutions to the problem.

This mission guided my career moves until the coronavirus struck. My prospects at a solar microgrid startup were derailed by an early-pandemic hiring freeze, after which a furious job hunt led me to teach high school-level STEM in Oakland.

I enjoy teaching and value the relationships I've built here, but the existential dread of the climate crisis still weighs heavily on me. For this reason, my next steps involve further developing my tech skills so I can jump into the clean tech space and make an impact. Until then, I'm focused on being the best teacher I can be and educating a new generation about solving the problems of the future.

); } } export default Home
